meanings.definition: To build or construct a tall tower or spire.
meanings.sent1: The workers will minar a new skyscraper in the city center.
meanings.sent2: The architects plan to minar a beautiful lighthouse by the coast.
meanings.sent3: It would be funny to see a robot try to minar a tower out of lego blocks.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to minar a successful career was as strong as the tallest building.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization used to minar grand structures to honor their gods.

meanings.definition: A tall tower or spire, typically found in Islamic architecture.
meanings.sent1: The minar stood proudly against the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent2: Visitors marveled at the intricate design of the minar in the mosque.
meanings.sent3: The minar looked like a giant pencil standing on end.
meanings.sent4: The minar's shadow stretched across the courtyard like a protective cloak.
meanings.sent5: The minar's call to prayer echoed through the ancient city, guiding the faithful.
